properties.name: camel.main.allow-use-original-message
properties.description: Sets whether to allow access to the original message from Camel's error handler, or from org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork.getOriginalInMessage(). Turning this off can optimize performance, as defensive copy of the original message is not needed. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.auto-configuration-enabled
properties.description: Whether auto configuration of components, dataformats, languages is enabled or not. When enabled the configuration parameters are loaded from the properties component and optionally from the classpath file META-INF/services/org/apache/camel/autowire.properties. You can prefix the parameters in the properties file with: - camel.component.name.option1=value1 - camel.component.name.option2=value2 - camel.dataformat.name.option1=value1 - camel.dataformat.name.option2=value2 - camel.language.name.option1=value1 - camel.language.name.option2=value2 Where name is the name of the component, dataformat or language such as seda,direct,jaxb. The auto configuration also works for any options on components that is a complex type (not standard Java type) and there has been an explicit single bean instance registered to the Camel registry via the org.apache.camel.spi.Registry#bind(String,Object) method or by using the org.apache.camel.BindToRegistry annotation style. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.auto-configuration-environment-variables-enabled
properties.description: Whether auto configuration should include OS environment variables as well. When enabled this allows to overrule any configuration using an OS environment variable. For example to set a shutdown timeout of 5 seconds: CAMEL_MAIN_SHUTDOWNTIMEOUT=5. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.auto-configuration-fail-fast
properties.description: Whether auto configuration should fail fast when configuring one ore more properties fails for whatever reason such as a invalid property name, etc. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.auto-configuration-log-summary
properties.description: Whether auto configuration should log a summary with the configured properties. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.auto-startup
properties.description: Sets whether the object should automatically start when Camel starts. Important: Currently only routes can be disabled, as CamelContext's are always started. Note: When setting auto startup false on CamelContext then that takes precedence and no routes is started. You would need to start CamelContext explicit using the org.apache.camel.CamelContext.start() method, to start the context, and then you would need to start the routes manually using CamelContext.getRouteController().startRoute(String). Default is true to always start up.

properties.name: camel.main.autowire-component-properties
properties.description: Whether autowiring components with properties that are of same type, which has been added to the Camel registry, as a singleton instance. This is used for convention over configuration to inject DataSource, AmazonLogin instances to the components. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.autowire-component-properties-allow-private-setter
properties.description: Whether autowiring components allows to use private setter method when setting the value. This may be needed in some rare situations when some configuration classes may configure via constructors over setters. But constructor configuration is more cumbersome to use via .properties files etc.

properties.name: camel.main.autowire-component-properties-deep
properties.description: Whether autowiring components (with deep nesting by attempting to walk as deep down the object graph by creating new empty objects on the way if needed) with properties that are of same type, which has been added to the Camel registry, as a singleton instance. This is used for convention over configuration to inject DataSource, AmazonLogin instances to the components. This option is default disabled.

properties.name: camel.main.backlog-tracing
properties.description: Sets whether backlog tracing is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.consumer-template-cache-size
properties.description: Consumer template endpoints cache size.

properties.name: camel.main.duration-hit-exit-code
properties.description: Sets the exit code for the application if duration was hit

properties.name: camel.main.duration-max-idle-seconds
properties.description: To specify for how long time in seconds Camel can be idle before automatic terminating the JVM. You can use this to run Camel for a short while.

properties.name: camel.main.duration-max-messages
properties.description: To specify how many messages to process by Camel before automatic terminating the JVM. You can use this to run Camel for a short while.

properties.name: camel.main.duration-max-seconds
properties.description: To specify for how long time in seconds to keep running the JVM before automatic terminating the JVM. You can use this to run Camel for a short while.

properties.name: camel.main.endpoint-runtime-statistics-enabled
properties.description: Sets whether endpoint runtime statistics is enabled (gathers runtime usage of each incoming and outgoing endpoints). The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.main.file-configurations
properties.description: Directory to load additional configuration files that contains configuration values that takes precedence over any other configuration. This can be used to refer to files that may have secret configuration that has been mounted on the file system for containers. You can specify a pattern to load from sub directories and a name pattern such as /var/app/secret/.properties, multiple directories can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.main.hangup-interceptor-enabled
properties.description: Whether to use graceful hangup when Camel is stopping or when the JVM terminates.

properties.name: camel.main.jmx-create-connector
properties.description: Whether JMX connector is created, allowing clients to connect remotely The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.main.jmx-enabled
properties.description: Enable JMX in your Camel application.

properties.name: camel.main.jmx-management-name-pattern
properties.description: The naming pattern for creating the CamelContext JMX management name. The default pattern is #name#

properties.name: camel.main.jmx-management-statistics-level
properties.description: Sets the JMX statistics level The level can be set to Extended to gather additional information The default value is Default.

properties.name: camel.main.load-type-converters
properties.description: Whether to load custom type converters by scanning classpath. This is used for backwards compatibility with Camel 2.x. Its recommended to migrate to use fast type converter loading by setting Converter(loader = true) on your custom type converter classes.

properties.name: camel.main.log-debug-max-chars
properties.description: Is used to limit the maximum length of the logging Camel message bodies. If the message body is longer than the limit, the log message is clipped. Use -1 to have unlimited length. Use for example 1000 to log at most 1000 characters.

properties.name: camel.main.log-exhausted-message-body
properties.description: Sets whether to log exhausted message body with message history. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.log-mask
properties.description: Sets whether log mask is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.mdc-logging-keys-pattern
properties.description: Sets the pattern used for determine which custom MDC keys to propagate during message routing when the routing engine continues routing asynchronously for the given message. Setting this pattern to will propagate all custom keys. Or setting the pattern to foo,bar will propagate any keys starting with either foo or bar. Notice that a set of standard Camel MDC keys are always propagated which starts with camel. as key name. The match rules are applied in this order (case insensitive): 1. exact match, returns true 2. wildcard match (pattern ends with a and the name starts with the pattern), returns true 3. regular expression match, returns true 4. otherwise returns false

properties.name: camel.main.message-history
properties.description: Sets whether message history is enabled or not. Default is true.

properties.name: camel.main.name
properties.description: Sets the name of the CamelContext.

properties.name: camel.main.producer-template-cache-size
properties.description: Producer template endpoints cache size.

properties.name: camel.main.route-filter-exclude-pattern
properties.description: Used for filtering routes routes matching the given pattern, which follows the following rules: - Match by route id - Match by route input endpoint uri The matching is using exact match, by wildcard and regular expression as documented by PatternHelper#matchPattern(String,String) . For example to only include routes which starts with foo in their route id's, use: include=foo* And to exclude routes which starts from JMS endpoints, use: exclude=jms:* Multiple patterns can be separated by comma, for example to exclude both foo and bar routes, use: exclude=foo*,bar* Exclude takes precedence over include.

properties.name: camel.main.route-filter-include-pattern
properties.description: Used for filtering routes routes matching the given pattern, which follows the following rules: - Match by route id - Match by route input endpoint uri The matching is using exact match, by wildcard and regular expression as documented by PatternHelper#matchPattern(String,String) . For example to only include routes which starts with foo in their route id's, use: include=foo* And to exclude routes which starts from JMS endpoints, use: exclude=jms:* Multiple patterns can be separated by comma, for example to exclude both foo and bar routes, use: exclude=foo*,bar* Exclude takes precedence over include.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdown-log-inflight-exchanges-on-timeout
properties.description: Sets whether to log information about the inflight Exchanges which are still running during a shutdown which didn't complete without the given timeout.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdown-now-on-timeout
properties.description: Sets whether to force shutdown of all consumers when a timeout occurred and thus not all consumers was shutdown within that period. You should have good reasons to set this option to false as it means that the routes keep running and is halted abruptly when CamelContext has been shutdown.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdown-routes-in-reverse-order
properties.description: Sets whether routes should be shutdown in reverse or the same order as they where started.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdown-suppress-logging-on-timeout
properties.description: Whether Camel should try to suppress logging during shutdown and timeout was triggered, meaning forced shutdown is happening. And during forced shutdown we want to avoid logging errors/warnings et all in the logs as a side-effect of the forced timeout. Notice the suppress is a best effort as there may still be some logs coming from 3rd party libraries and whatnot, which Camel cannot control. This option is default false.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdown-timeout
properties.description: Timeout in seconds to graceful shutdown Camel.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-any-spool-rules
properties.description: Sets whether if just any of the org.apache.camel.spi.StreamCachingStrategy.SpoolRule rules returns true then shouldSpoolCache(long) returns true, to allow spooling to disk. If this option is false, then all the org.apache.camel.spi.StreamCachingStrategy.SpoolRule must return true. The default value is false which means that all the rules must return true.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-buffer-size
properties.description: Sets the stream caching buffer size to use when allocating in-memory buffers used for in-memory stream caches. The default size is 4096.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-enabled
properties.description: Sets whether stream caching is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-remove-spool-directory-when-stopping
properties.description: Whether to remove stream caching temporary directory when stopping. This option is default true.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-spool-cipher
properties.description: Sets a stream caching cipher name to use when spooling to disk to write with encryption. By default the data is not encrypted.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-spool-directory
properties.description: Sets the stream caching spool (temporary) directory to use for overflow and spooling to disk. If no spool directory has been explicit configured, then a temporary directory is created in the java.io.tmpdir directory.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-spool-threshold
properties.description: Stream caching threshold in bytes when overflow to disk is activated. The default threshold is 128kb. Use -1 to disable overflow to disk.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-spool-used-heap-memory-limit
properties.description: Sets what the upper bounds should be when streamCachingSpoolUsedHeapMemoryThreshold is in use.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-spool-used-heap-memory-threshold
properties.description: Sets a percentage (1-99) of used heap memory threshold to activate stream caching spooling to disk.

properties.name: camel.main.stream-caching-statistics-enabled
properties.description: Sets whether stream caching statistics is enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.thread-name-pattern
properties.description: Sets the thread name pattern used for creating the full thread name. The default pattern is: Camel (#camelId#) thread ##counter# - #name# Where #camelId# is the name of the CamelContext. and #counter# is a unique incrementing counter. and #name# is the regular thread name. You can also use #longName# which is the long thread name which can includes endpoint parameters etc.

properties.name: camel.main.tracing
properties.description: Sets whether tracing is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.tracing-pattern
properties.description: Tracing pattern to match which node EIPs to trace. For example to match all To EIP nodes, use to. The pattern matches by node and route id's Multiple patterns can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.main.use-breadcrumb
properties.description: Set whether breadcrumb is enabled. The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.main.use-data-type
properties.description: Whether to enable using data type on Camel messages. Data type are automatic turned on if one ore more routes has been explicit configured with input and output types. Otherwise data type is default off.

properties.name: camel.main.use-mdc-logging
properties.description: To turn on MDC logging

properties.name: camel.hystrix.allow-maximum-size-to-diverge-from-core-size
properties.description: Allows the configuration for maximumSize to take effect. That value can then be equal to, or higher, than coreSize

properties.name: camel.hystrix.circuit-breaker-enabled
properties.description: Whether to use a HystrixCircuitBreaker or not. If false no circuit-breaker logic will be used and all requests permitted. This is similar in effect to circuitBreakerForceClosed() except that continues tracking metrics and knowing whether it should be open/closed, this property results in not even instantiating a circuit-breaker.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.circuit-breaker-error-threshold-percentage
properties.description: Error percentage threshold (as whole number such as 50) at which point the circuit breaker will trip open and reject requests. It will stay tripped for the duration defined in circuitBreakerSleepWindowInMilliseconds; The error percentage this is compared against comes from HystrixCommandMetrics.getHealthCounts().

properties.name: camel.hystrix.circuit-breaker-force-closed
properties.description: If true the HystrixCircuitBreaker#allowRequest() will always return true to allow requests regardless of the error percentage from HystrixCommandMetrics.getHealthCounts(). The circuitBreakerForceOpen() property takes precedence so if it set to true this property does nothing.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.circuit-breaker-force-open
properties.description: If true the HystrixCircuitBreaker.allowRequest() will always return false, causing the circuit to be open (tripped) and reject all requests. This property takes precedence over circuitBreakerForceClosed();

properties.name: camel.hystrix.circuit-breaker-request-volume-threshold
properties.description: Minimum number of requests in the metricsRollingStatisticalWindowInMilliseconds() that must exist before the HystrixCircuitBreaker will trip. If below this number the circuit will not trip regardless of error percentage.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.circuit-breaker-sleep-window-in-milliseconds
properties.description: The time in milliseconds after a HystrixCircuitBreaker trips open that it should wait before trying requests again.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.core-pool-size
properties.description: Core thread-pool size that gets passed to java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor#setCorePoolSize(int)

properties.name: camel.hystrix.execution-isolation-semaphore-max-concurrent-requests
properties.description: Number of concurrent requests permitted to HystrixCommand.run(). Requests beyond the concurrent limit will be rejected. Applicable only when executionIsolationStrategy == SEMAPHORE.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.execution-isolation-strategy
properties.description: What isolation strategy HystrixCommand.run() will be executed with. If THREAD then it will be executed on a separate thread and concurrent requests limited by the number of threads in the thread-pool. If SEMAPHORE then it will be executed on the calling thread and concurrent requests limited by the semaphore count.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.execution-isolation-thread-interrupt-on-timeout
properties.description: Whether the execution thread should attempt an interrupt (using Future#cancel ) when a thread times out. Applicable only when executionIsolationStrategy() == THREAD.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.execution-timeout-enabled
properties.description: Whether the timeout mechanism is enabled for this command

properties.name: camel.hystrix.execution-timeout-in-milliseconds
properties.description: Time in milliseconds at which point the command will timeout and halt execution. If executionIsolationThreadInterruptOnTimeout == true and the command is thread-isolated, the executing thread will be interrupted. If the command is semaphore-isolated and a HystrixObservableCommand, that command will get unsubscribed.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.fallback-enabled
properties.description: Whether HystrixCommand.getFallback() should be attempted when failure occurs.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.fallback-isolation-semaphore-max-concurrent-requests
properties.description: Number of concurrent requests permitted to HystrixCommand.getFallback(). Requests beyond the concurrent limit will fail-fast and not attempt retrieving a fallback.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.group-key
properties.description: Sets the group key to use. The default value is CamelHystrix.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.keep-alive-time
properties.description: Keep-alive time in minutes that gets passed to ThreadPoolExecutor#setKeepAliveTime(long,TimeUnit)

properties.name: camel.hystrix.maximum-size
properties.description: Maximum thread-pool size that gets passed to ThreadPoolExecutor#setMaximumPoolSize(int) . This is the maximum amount of concurrency that can be supported without starting to reject HystrixCommands. Please note that this setting only takes effect if you also set allowMaximumSizeToDivergeFromCoreSize

properties.name: camel.hystrix.max-queue-size
properties.description: Max queue size that gets passed to BlockingQueue in HystrixConcurrencyStrategy.getBlockingQueue(int) This should only affect the instantiation of a threadpool - it is not eliglible to change a queue size on the fly. For that, use queueSizeRejectionThreshold().

properties.name: camel.hystrix.metrics-health-snapshot-interval-in-milliseconds
properties.description: Time in milliseconds to wait between allowing health snapshots to be taken that calculate success and error percentages and affect HystrixCircuitBreaker.isOpen() status. On high-volume circuits the continual calculation of error percentage can become CPU intensive thus this controls how often it is calculated.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.metrics-rolling-percentile-bucket-size
properties.description: Maximum number of values stored in each bucket of the rolling percentile. This is passed into HystrixRollingPercentile inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.metrics-rolling-percentile-enabled
properties.description: Whether percentile metrics should be captured using HystrixRollingPercentile inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.metrics-rolling-percentile-window-buckets
properties.description: Number of buckets the rolling percentile window is broken into. This is passed into HystrixRollingPercentile inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.metrics-rolling-percentile-window-in-milliseconds
properties.description: Duration of percentile rolling window in milliseconds. This is passed into HystrixRollingPercentile inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.metrics-rolling-statistical-window-buckets
properties.description: Number of buckets the rolling statistical window is broken into. This is passed into HystrixRollingNumber inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.metrics-rolling-statistical-window-in-milliseconds
properties.description: This property sets the duration of the statistical rolling window, in milliseconds. This is how long metrics are kept for the thread pool. The window is divided into buckets and rolls by those increments.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.queue-size-rejection-threshold
properties.description: Queue size rejection threshold is an artificial max size at which rejections will occur even if maxQueueSize has not been reached. This is done because the maxQueueSize of a BlockingQueue can not be dynamically changed and we want to support dynamically changing the queue size that affects rejections. This is used by HystrixCommand when queuing a thread for execution.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.request-log-enabled
properties.description: Whether HystrixCommand execution and events should be logged to HystrixRequestLog.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.thread-pool-key
properties.description: Sets the thread pool key to use. Will by default use the same value as groupKey has been configured to use.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.thread-pool-rolling-number-statistical-window-buckets
properties.description: Number of buckets the rolling statistical window is broken into. This is passed into HystrixRollingNumber inside each HystrixThreadPoolMetrics instance.

properties.name: camel.hystrix.thread-pool-rolling-number-statistical-window-in-milliseconds
properties.description: Duration of statistical rolling window in milliseconds. This is passed into HystrixRollingNumber inside each HystrixThreadPoolMetrics instance.

properties.name: camel.rest.api-component
properties.description: Sets the name of the Camel component to use as the REST API (such as swagger)

properties.name: camel.rest.api-context-id-pattern
properties.description: Optional CamelContext id pattern to only allow Rest APIs from rest services within CamelContext's which name matches the pattern. The pattern #name# refers to the CamelContext name, to match on the current CamelContext only. For any other value, the pattern uses the rules from org.apache.camel.support.EndpointHelper#matchPattern(String,String)

properties.name: camel.rest.api-context-listing
properties.description: Sets whether listing of all available CamelContext's with REST services in the JVM is enabled. If enabled it allows to discover these contexts, if false then only the current CamelContext is in use.

properties.name: camel.rest.api-context-path
properties.description: Sets a leading API context-path the REST API services will be using. This can be used when using components such as camel-servlet where the deployed web application is deployed using a context-path.

properties.name: camel.rest.api-context-route-id
properties.description: Sets the route id to use for the route that services the REST API. The route will by default use an auto assigned route id.

properties.name: camel.rest.api-host
properties.description: To use an specific hostname for the API documentation (eg swagger) This can be used to override the generated host with this configured hostname

properties.name: camel.rest.api-properties
properties.description: Sets additional options on api level

properties.name: camel.rest.api-vendor-extension
properties.description: Whether vendor extension is enabled in the Rest APIs. If enabled then Camel will include additional information as vendor extension (eg keys starting with x-) such as route ids, class names etc. Not all 3rd party API gateways and tools supports vendor-extensions when importing your API docs.

properties.name: camel.rest.binding-mode
properties.description: Sets the binding mode to be used by the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.client-request-validation
properties.description: Whether to enable validation of the client request to check whether the Content-Type and Accept headers from the client is supported by the Rest-DSL configuration of its consumes/produces settings. This can be turned on, to enable this check. In case of validation error, then HTTP Status codes 415 or 406 is returned. The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.rest.component
properties.description: Sets the name of the Camel component to use as the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.component-properties
properties.description: Sets additional options on component level

properties.name: camel.rest.consumer-properties
properties.description: Sets additional options on consumer level

properties.name: camel.rest.context-path
properties.description: Sets a leading context-path the REST services will be using. This can be used when using components such as camel-servlet where the deployed web application is deployed using a context-path. Or for components such as camel-jetty or camel-netty-http that includes a HTTP server.

properties.name: camel.rest.cors-headers
properties.description: Sets the CORS headers to use if CORS has been enabled.

properties.name: camel.rest.data-format-properties
properties.description: Sets additional options on data format level

properties.name: camel.rest.enable-cors
properties.description: To specify whether to enable CORS which means Camel will automatic include CORS in the HTTP headers in the response. This option is default false

properties.name: camel.rest.endpoint-properties
properties.description: Sets additional options on endpoint level

properties.name: camel.rest.host
properties.description: Sets the hostname to use by the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.host-name-resolver
properties.description: Sets the resolver to use for resolving hostname

properties.name: camel.rest.json-data-format
properties.description: Sets a custom json data format to be used Important: This option is only for setting a custom name of the data format, not to refer to an existing data format instance.

properties.name: camel.rest.port
properties.description: Sets the port to use by the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.producer-api-doc
properties.description: Sets the location of the api document (swagger api) the REST producer will use to validate the REST uri and query parameters are valid accordingly to the api document. This requires adding camel-swagger-java to the classpath, and any miss configuration will let Camel fail on startup and report the error(s). The location of the api document is loaded from classpath by default, but you can use file: or http: to refer to resources to load from file or http url.

properties.name: camel.rest.producer-component
properties.description: Sets the name of the Camel component to use as the REST producer

properties.name: camel.rest.scheme
properties.description: Sets the scheme to use by the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.skip-binding-on-error-code
properties.description: Whether to skip binding output if there is a custom HTTP error code, and instead use the response body as-is. This option is default true.

properties.name: camel.rest.use-x-forward-headers
properties.description: WWhether to use X-Forward headers to set host etc. for Swagger. This option is default true.

properties.name: camel.rest.xml-data-format
properties.description: Sets a custom xml data format to be used. Important: This option is only for setting a custom name of the data format, not to refer to an existing data format instance.
